text: Otto Fritz Meyerhof (April 12, 1884 - October 6, 1951) was a German doctor and biochemist of Jewish descent. He won the 1922 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, for finding out how oxygen makes chemical changes in lactic acid in muscles. In 1940, Meyerhof fled to the United States, where he continued his academic career. ==Related pages== *List of biologists == References == Category:1884 births Category:1951 deaths Category:German biochemists Category:German doctors Category:German Nobel Prize winners Category:Jewish German academics Category:Jewish German scientists Category:Jewish Nobel Prize winners Category:People from Hanover Category:Refugees from Nazism
title: Otto Fritz Meyerhof
